document.ModsDocTitle: Descriptions of three new carbonaria-group species of Fannia Robineau-Desvoidy from China, with a key to the carbonaria-group species (Diptera, Fanniidae)
document.docAuthor: Wang, Ming-fu, Li, Wei, Zhao, Yu-wan, Wu, Jie & Zhang, Dong
document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions of three new carbonaria-group species of Fannia Robineau-Desvoidy from China, with a key to the carbonaria-group species (Diptera, Fanniidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions of three new carbonaria-group species of Fannia Robineau-Desvoidy from China, with a key to the carbonaria-group species (Diptera, Fanniidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: This species is characterized as follows: parafacial bare; occipital setae absent; lower calypter distinctly projecting beyond upper one; haltere yellowish or brownish yellow; mid tibia with 2 ad; hind femur with a complete pv row, not becoming gradually weaker towards apex; hind tibia with 2 or 3 ad; syntergite 1+2 to tergite 4 each with a dark median triangular stripe, tergite 5 with a broad median stripe; sternite 5 broad and with four strong setulae; bacilliform sclerite curved.

caption.paragraph: Figure 4. Fannia norvegica Ringdahl, 1934, male (specimen from Ningxia, deposited in IESNU). A Terminalia, ventral view B Terminalia, lateral view C Sternite 5, ventral view. Scale bars 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: The species Fannia norvegica Ringdahl, 1934 is newly recorded from China. Here, a detailed redescription is provided as it was not been adequately described previously. Illustrations of male terminalia including sternite 5 is also given.

1 male, China, Ningxia, Jingyuan, Mt. Heshangpu, 2000 m, 23.VI.2008, Coll. M.F. Wang (IESNU); 1 male, China, Ningxia, Jingyuan, Mt. Heshangpu, 2150 m, 24.VI.2008, Coll. Y.X. Wu (IESNU); 1 male, China, Ningxia, Jingyuan, Mt. Baiyun, 2300 m, 28.VI.2008, Coll. M.F. Wang (IESNU).
China: Ningxia, Jingyuan; Czech Republic, Denmark, Great Britain, Greek, Japan, North Africa, Norway, Spain, Switzerland, throughout North America.
